subject: Photography
title: Photography as Fine Art Market
description: A 60-second lesson on Photography as Fine Art Market.

hook.text: A photograph by Andreas Gursky sold for $4.3 million. Photography entered the fine art world ‚Äî and its prices.

buildup.text: For decades, galleries considered photography a craft, not fine art. That changed in the late 20th century.

discovery.text: Limited editions, large-format prints, and gallery representation turned photographs into collectible art objects.

twist.text: Unlike painting, a photograph can be reprinted infinitely. Scarcity is artificial ‚Äî enforced by edition numbering.

climax.text: The fine art photography market proves that value comes from concept and authorship ‚Äî not just the physical print.

punchline.text: A photo is worth millions ‚Äî if the right name is behind it.
